author: Shiv Sahay Singh
text:
LJP to field two transgenders in West Bengal Assembly polls

Two transgenders have announced that they will contest the West Bengal Assembly elections with one challenging Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee in the Bhawanipore Assembly segment.

Lok Janshakti Party’s vice-president Ram Chandra Paswan on Friday announced that Bobby Halder, 39, a transgender, would contest on the party ticket from Bhawanipore.

This makes Bhawanipore — where former Union Minister Deepa Dasmunsi is the combined candidate of the Left Front-Congress alliance and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose’s grandnephew Chandra Kumar Bose is the BJP candidate — most colourful in terms of candidates.

Speaking to The Hindu , Bobby Halder said the Constitution had given every citizen the right to contest polls. “Over the years, so many parties came but none gave us ticket. I am happy.”
title: Transgender to contest against Mamata
